thread.title: Brits warned to STAY AWAY as MASSIVE sea creature stalks coast
thread.title_full: Brits warned to STAY AWAY as MASSIVE sea creature stalks coast

title: Brits warned to STAY AWAY as MASSIVE sea creature stalks coast
text:
“People can be fined up to £5,000 if they harass whales” Lindy Hingley 
A Border Force cutter was scrambled to stop other boats getting too close to the whale. 
Lindy Hingley of Brixham Sea Watch said they were worried about the whale and reminded people not to get near to it. 
"People can be fined up to £5,000 if they harass whales," she warned. 
"We are still not sure if it has a calf with it or not. I have never seen a humpback and here is one that may well be in trouble. 
"It's behaving oddly, the fact it has stayed in Start Bay for three days is not good.” 
SWNS LEAP: Experts are concerned for the big creature Scary sea creatures found in Russia Thursday, 29th December 2016 Roman Fedortsov is a deep sea fisherman in Russia. And he’s been taking photos of OH MY GOD WHAT IS THAT? 1 / 23 
She added: "I don't want to spread doom and gloom but it's way away from where it should be.” 
Tourists and locals rushed down to the coast to watch the massive animal through telescopes and take pictures. 
Humpbacks can range in length from 12 to 16 metres and weigh in at a massive 36,000kg. Related articles
